A.name: Children of Eorl
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75]We would like to thank the hard-working people at FFG for creating the beloved card game. We hope we have done proper justice to its legacy with this fan expansion. In particular, we would like to thank Nate French, Lukas Litzsinger, MJ Newman, and Caleb Grace for their role in leading the game design over the last 10 years. And finally, we would like to thank you, the player, for taking interest in our project and making this community one of the best communities in Arda.

[right]--The ALeP Team



[center][img custom/Image-Thieves-and-Coursers-Mask.png 2.0in][/center]

A.name: Children of Eorl Rules 1
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][center][img custom/Title-Children-of-Eorl.png 1.1in][/center]
Welcome to [i]Children of Eorl[/i], an [b]unofficial[/b] fan expansion, developed by A Long-extended Party (ALeP).

This expansion explores the vast country of Rohan. Three original scenarios take the players on a journey from Anorien, through the Eastfold, to the town of Aldburg.


[img custom/Header-Component-Overview.png 1.35in 0.127in]
[i]Children of Eorl[/i] expansion includes 196 cards, consisting of: 

[space][tab]* 9 Rules Cards[space][tab]* 126 Encounter Cards
[space][tab]* 4 Hero Cards[space][tab][tab]* 8 Quest Cards
[space][tab]* 48 Player Cards[tab][tab]* 1 Contract Card
 

[img custom/Header-Web-Resources.png 1.0in 0.105in]
You can check for any updates from A Long-extended Party at www.alongextendedparty.com.

You can build decks and track your plays of these scenarios and others online through RingsDB at
www.ringsdb.com.

For general rules and definitions of common game terms, visit the Quest Companion at bit.ly/2MKkak9.

A.name: Children of Eorl Rules 2
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][img custom/Header-Expansion-Symbol.png 1.16in 0.125in]
The cards in the [i]Children of Eorl[/i] expansion can be identified by this symbol before each card's collector number.

[center][img custom/Expansion-Symbol.png 0.25in][/center]


[img custom/Header-Rules-and-New-Terms.png 1.28in 0.125in]

[img custom/Header-Devoted.png 0.425in]
The Devoted keyword appears on some player cards in this cycle. While each hero you control shares at least one trait with an ally with the Devoted keyword, that ally does not require a resource match. The trait that is shared does not need to be the same for each hero.

For example, an ally with the Devoted keyword and the [bi]Gondor[/bi] and [bi]Scout[/bi] traits may be played without a resource match if all of your heroes have the [bi]Gondor[/bi] trait, all of your heroes have the [bi]Scout[/bi] trait, or some of your heroes have the [bi]Gondor[/bi] trait and the remainder have the [bi]Scout[/bi] trait.

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 1
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][img custom/Header-Vast.png 0.225in]
The Vast keyword appears on some locations in this cycle, and represents the large distances the players must travel when journeying from place to place within Rohan. Each location with the Vast keyword is considered to be a "vast location", with the following additional text: 

Travel: Each player must either exhaust a [bi]Mount[/bi] attachment or a hero they control.

and

Response: After placing progress on this location from questing successfully (even if this location is explored), place an additional progress on any vast location for each [bi]Mount[/bi] attachment the players control.


[img custom/Header-Ambush-at-Erelas.png 1.1in]
[b]Difficulty level = 5[/b]

[i]The funeral in Lossarnach had been a somber affair. Within the confines of a family mausoleum, surrounded by kin and the vassals of her departed father, Morwen Steelsheen had not wept. She was a queen, stoic and tall, of the blood of Numenor. She remained by the tomb seven days and seven nights, a black gown and belt of white chrysanthemum her only adornments.[/i]

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 2
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]In the absence of her husband Thengel, King of Rohan, Morwen was guarded at all times by several companions - heroes, chosen from among the mighty and the wise as her honor guard. The last was a noble of Rohan, a man called Galmod, who had been her close friend and advocate in court since her arrival many years ago.

When her vigil had ended and the last of the mourners departed, only then did Morwen Steelsheen allow a pang of sadness to cross her face.Then she kissed the cold, white stone of her father's sarcophagus, straightened herself, and emerged into the chill of an autumn morning. The honor guard followed close behind, joined by a column of Galmod's mounted Rohirrim.

It was this band which ventured from the Vale of Flowers toward the borders of Rohan, where Morwen's king - and kingdom - awaited. "You must be pleased to return home, my lady," said one of the heroes.

"Home," said the queen. [lquot]I dare not linger on the thought. In my years I have dwelt on the shores of Belfalas and the green valleys of Lossarnach, yet now when I think of home I think only of the tapestries hanging in Meduseld. Of warm mead and kindly kin. Of Rohan, of the tribe of horse-lords which have so well[/i]

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 3
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]adopted me.[rquot]

"Rohan has been a good home to many," said Galmod. "Though not to all." A raven passed overhead, dark and silent as it disappeared into a plume of mist pouring from Mindolluin and the great White Mountains beyond.

The group stayed an evening in the great city of Minas Tirith, where the aging steward feasted Morwen and her companions. In the morning they continued on, but they had not yet traveled a league before they were hailed by a lone rider on the road.

"My queen," said the rider, lowering his hood.

"Thorongil," said Morwen, embracing him. "Long has it been since you graced our halls at Edoras."

"I come with ill news," he told her.

"What have you seen, ranger?" asked Galmod. "Orcs come down from the mountains?"

"Aye, orcs and strange men."

"Phaw," said Galmod. "Foolish warnings from foolish wanderers. The queen has men enough to ward off mere ruffians."

"I thank you for the warning, master ranger." Morwen[/i]

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 4
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]bowed in her saddle.

"I must away," said Thorongil. "Heed my words," he added, looking upon Galmod. The ranger spurred his horse and continued at a trot toward the white city of Minas Tirith.

Days later, the party had finally rounded the bend in a long road and now journeyed with the Druadan Forest at their left shoulder. Before them stretched the broad, grassy lands of Anorien.

One of the heroes gripped the bow slung across the horn of her saddle. "Thorongil's warning perplexes me. We should shelter in the encampment at Erelas for the night."

"My men shall scout ahead," said Galmod. He signalled one of his captains, and the Rohirrim set off toward the bald green hill of Erelas and the encampment in its shadow. Galmod remained behind. He tugged at his hauberk and clenched the pommel of his sword. "My queen," he said, but he soon fell silent.

As the day wore into evening, one of the heroes frowned. "Your scouts have not returned, Galmod."

"Indeed," said the noble. "Something must have delayed them in Erelas. It is not far now."[/i]

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 5
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]The settlement was oddly quiet. The heroes caught the flicker of a torch, a manlike shape loping into the shadow of a barn and disappearing. "Something's not right," said Morwen.

As she spoke a dark bird swept over the crossroads, soaring high, streaking through the moonlight and descending in an arc. But it was not a bird. It was an arrow, one of many, darkening the air.

"The queen!" cried Galmod. "Protect the queen!" He wheeled his horse, blade high and flashing as the flock of arrows came, followed by voices, howling in a strange tongue the words for blood and gold and fire.

"Ambush at Erelas" is played with an encounter deck built with all the cards from the following encounter sets: Ambush at Erelas, Rohan Weather, and Rohan Encampment. These sets are indicated by the following icons:[/i]

[center][img custom/Encounter-Icons-Ambush-at-Erelas.png 1.28in][/center]

A.name: Loot Piles and Looter X
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][img custom/Header-Loot-Piles.png 0.65in]
"Ambush at Erelas" sees the players set upon by brigands looting their valuable supplies and resources. Some cards and abilities refer to an enemy's or objective's loot pile. A loot pile is a faceup pile of player cards placed next to that enemy or objective. Cards in a loot pile are not in play and are under no player's control. Cards in a loot pile are considered blank, except for their cost, sphere, and card type. Note that [b]an enemy or objective with 0 cards in its loot pile still has a loot pile[/b].


[img custom/Header-Looter.png 0.58in]
Looter is a new keyword that appears on enemies in this quest. After you engage an enemy with the Looter keyword, place a random card from your hand and the top X cards of your deck into that enemy's loot pile. This is done every time an enemy with the Looter keyword engages a player, even if there are already cards in that enemy's loot pile.

A.name: Ambush at Erelas 6
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][center][img custom/Do-Not-Read-the-Following.png 1.45in][/center]

[i]As the brigand ringleader fell to his knees, the enemy host scattered into the hills. "Scum!" cried Galmod, wild-eyed and panting.

Queen Morwen knelt before the captured enemy. "What wickedness brings you to this place?" she asked.

The ringleader smirked. He muttered something.

"He speaks the tongue of Dunland," said one of the heroes. "Dunlendings this far east? Surely they would have been spotted."

"He curses us!" said Galmod. "The cur besmirches the very name of Queen Morwen."

"No," said one of the heroes. "I can almost make it out. He's saying-"

Then Galmod unsheathed his dagger and flew with a frantic brutality onto the Dunlending, plunging his blade into the prisoner's heart.

"Galmod!" The heroes dragged away the furious nobleman, his limbs flailing wildly.[/i]

A.name: The Battle for the Beacon 1
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]The brigand fell into the dirt, his face stained with a look of pain and disappointment.

"He wasn't cursing us," said the hero. "Galmod, he was taunting us. He was telling us where they plan to strike next."

"Not strike," said another. "Struck."

There need be no more words. Morwen stood, her face mottled with ash and blood and soil. She looked to the hilltop in the distance and saw the dark shapes of men working furtively, half-masked by the haze of night. "Erelas," she said. "The beacon. They've captured the beacon."[/i]


[img custom/Header-The-Battle-for-the-Beacon.png 1.6in]
[b]Difficulty level = 7[/b]

[i]Racing toward the hill of Erelas, the heroes felt a surge of fear. The beacon atop the hill had been guarded by only a token force, hardly enough to handle a surprise attack like this. What had long stood as a signal of peace and safety was now crawling with Dunlendings.

Soon the heroes had left behind the encampment and began the arduous climb up the hill. Here and there the hill was girdled by a narrow stair carved in stone, but elsewhere the pathway had fallen into disrepair, and[/i]

A.name: The Battle for the Beacon 2
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]the masonry gave way to bare slate and slick moss. The heroes and their companions climbed chiefly in silence.

"What could they want with the beacon?" mumbled Galmod, his back hunched as he climbed a rocky slope toward the beacon.

"Nothing good," said one of the heroes. "It is used as a signal between Minas Tirith and Anorien. While it is captured, any call for aid or warning of attack would be long-delayed."

By the time they arrived at the edge of the beacon's platform, the heroes could overhear their enemies conversing brokenly in the language of the Rohirrim.

One of the heroes raised her head to peer into the darkness over a crumbling balustrade. A crew of scowling Dunlendings were addressing a Rohirrim rider wearing a helm with a white plume. The Rohirrim kept one hand on the pommel of his blade. "You are late," he said.

"Trouble in the camp below," said one of the Dunlendings.

"You straw-heads put up a fight," said another.

"And you dealt with them?" said the Rohirrim.

"Dead."[/i]

A.name: The Battle for the Beacon 3
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]"Have you brought the payment?" The Rohirrim extended his hand, and one of the Dunlendings begrudgingly clapped a purse of coins into it. "Then the beacon is yours." He tossed the pouch into the air and caught it in one hand.

Signalling a cadre of his fellow warriors, the rider strolled past the Dunlendings. "Make it look convincing," he said.

"Treachery among the ranks," whispered the hero.

"They shall pay with their lives for turning against kith and king," said Galmod. "May the blood of Eorl rebel against their very veins. Let us take the hill and light this valley with the death-pyres of traitors."

"Calm, Galmod." One of the heroes notched an arrow. "It is more important to hold the beacon than to seek revenge."

"Then prepare yourselves," said Galmod, drawing his sword. "For true queen and honored kin. For the sons and daughters of Rohan!"[/i]

A.name: The Battle for the Beacon 4
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]"The Battle for the Beacon" is played with an encounter deck built with all the cards from the following encounter sets: The Battle for the Beacon, Dunlending Warriors, and Faithless Rohirrim. These sets are indicated by the following icons:[/i]

[center][img custom/Encounter-Icons-The-Battle-for-the-Beacon.png 1.28in][/center]


[center][img custom/Do-Not-Read-the-Following.png 1.45in][/center]

[i]After hours of bloody fighting, the sun rose above the bald hill of Erelas. There, joined at last by Galmod's scouts, the heroes took stock of the battlefield.

"There were traitor Rohirrim among this group," said one of the heroes.

"But how could they betray their kingdom?" asked another. "And to what end?"

"There is a conspiracy afoot," said Queen Morwen. "Though how vast the net and how many of us shall be ensnared, I cannot guess."[/i]

A.name: The Battle for the Beacon 5
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]Galmod nudged the body of one of the slain enemies with the tip of his boot. "This one wears an odd sigil. A white horse on a field of red." His hands grasped the enemy's cape and tore it from the traitor's shoulders. He began to fold it. "This is not over," he said.

"Rogues," said Morwen. "We must return to Edoras at once."

At this, one of Galmod's riders spoke up. "This brings the reason for our delay, my queen. On our scouting, we intercepted a messenger from Aldburg. He brought word that an orc-host has crossed the Anduin and begun raiding in the Eastfold."

"Just as Thorongil warned," sneered Galmod. "Perhaps the ranger bore some wisdom after all."

"Then we must make haste to Aldburg," said Morwen. "For our wick is now burning from both ends. If we cannot beat back these raiders, I fear we will crumble from within."[/i]

A.name: The Horse Lord's Ire 1
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][img custom/Header-The-Horse-Lords-Ire.png 1.29in]
[b]Difficulty level = 7[/b]

[i]Riding north from Erelas, the heroes crossed the Great West Road into a grassy sea of hills and grazing pasture. The Eastfold looked just as it did in the tapestries of Edoras and the Books of Kings: pleasant, pastoral, and vast. The riders bent their heads into the wind and urged their steeds onward, for they had received word from Galmod's scouts that an orc-host had crossed the Anduin and begun marching toward the city of Aldburg. Worse yet, they seemed to be raiding horse farms on the way, strengthening their numbers with heavy war horses and butchering those who stood in their path.

"I grow concerned," said one of the heroes. "Orcs assault the countryside just as wild-men strike at the border."

"Aye," said another. "The realm of the horse-lords is caught between the forge and the fire."

"We shall seek aid at Aldburg," said Queen Morwen. "Eomund is the Marshal there. He is young and brash, but valiant. He will surely supply us with aid."

"We may not have time," called one of the heroes. "Look ahead!" He pointed toward a pillar of smoke[/i]

A.name: The Horse Lord's Ire 2
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]twisting in the distance.

"That smoke may be from the kingly stables of Thengel himself," said Galmod. "Woe to any orc who would desecrate the descendants of the Mearas with rotten whip or rusted spur."

Cresting a bald green hill, the heroes came upon a small orcish raiding party, its members tugging at the reins of two great horses. Turning to witness the clamor, one of the orcs shouted to the others - "Go get Thruk!" he bellowed. "Thruk'll spike 'em dead!"

"We must have caught them on their way back to the main force," said Morwen.

The captured horses were gorgeous, saddled for war, bodies strong and elegant in the light of morning.

"Flinthoof! Brightmane!" called Galmod. "The king's own horses. But where is their liege, Felarof the Mighty?"

The orc hefted his mass onto the stallion called Flinthoof. Brightmane, wild-eyed and bucking, jerked away from the orc and galloped for the hills.

"Let us rout them," said one of the heroes. "For the blood of horses! For the horses of kings!" They gathered their weapons and prepared to charge. Down[/i]

A.name: The Horse Lord's Ire 3
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]the hills and over the orcs they rode, coursing across the sunlit fields, to battle.

"The Horse Lord's Ire" is played with an encounter deck built with all the cards from the following encounter sets: The Horse Lord's Ire, Orc-Host, and Rohan Lands. These sets are indicated by the following icons:

[center][img custom/Encounter-Icons-The-Horse-Lords-Ire.png 1.28in][/center]


[center][img custom/Do-Not-Read-the-Following.png 1.45in][/center]

[i]The heroes made their final charge against the orcs, their steeds mighty and noble and valorous, trampling their former captors. Shattered and broken, the orcish mob fled east, and soon they were driven from sight.

"This is not the last we will see of that loathsome band," said Galmod. "We should press onward."

"Not alone," said Queen Morwen. [lquot]Not without the might of Rohan at our backs. We must ride to the city of Aldburg. There we can warn Eomund. He is Marshal of[/i]

A.name: The Horse Lord's Ire 4
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][i]the East-mark, advised by the wise and patient Ealdwulf. Together they will bring their forces to bear against the horde. Perhaps then we can uncover the truth behind the traitors who surrendered the beacon at Erelas. The sigil of the red field and white stallion.[rquot]

The heroes and their companions were greeted well in Aldburg, where they feasted and slept for the first time in what felt like years. It was there they met Ealdwulf, one of the most powerful nobles in Rohan and chief advisor to the young Marshal Eomund.

"Your warnings are dire," said Ealdwulf, sipping wine from a golden goblet. The fire crackled in his feasting-hall as the heroes and their companions conferred. "And they are appreciated. The Marshal will hear of this immediately, and my eored will ride at first dawn to the Anduin. They will not rest until they have avenged the sullying of our land. It is this other matter which concerns me," he said. "Traitors amongst us. I have some thoughts on the matter, for the white horse on a red field is no strange symbol to the men of Aldburg. But for tonight, let us take stock and consider our options. In the morning, I shall tell you all I know."[/i]

[b]To be continued in "The Aldburg Plot" the first Adventure Pack in the "Oaths of the Rohirrim" cycle.[/b]

A.name: Ingold
A.text: Response: After a [bi]Gondor[/bi] or [bi]Warrior[/bi] ally enters play under your control, draw 1 card. Then, either spend 1 resource from Ingold's pool or raise your threat by 1. (Limit once per phase.)

A.name: Celador
A.text:
Reduce the total [threat] in the staging area by 1 for each unattached [bi]Trap[/bi] you control.

Response: After a [bi]Trap[/bi] card you control is attached to an enemy, either ready Celador or reduce your threat by 1.

A.name: Thengel
A.text: Response: After an ally is discarded from play, that ally's owner searches the top 5 cards of their deck for an ally that shares a [bi]Trait[/bi] with the discarded ally, puts it into play exhausted, and shuffles their deck. (Limit once per round.)

A.name: Herubrand
A.text:
Herubrand gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with at least 1 restricted attachment.

Response: After an enemy in the staging area is destroyed, draw 1 card.

A.name: Deeping Bowman
A.text: Action: Discard Deeping Bowman to choose an enemy. Until the end of the phase, that enemy does not count its [defense] while determining combat damage.

A.name: Open the Gates
A.text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally that shares a [bi]Trait[/bi] with each of your heroes and put it into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the phase, if that ally did not leave play, add it to your hand.

A.name: Wealth of Adventure
A.text: Action: Search your deck for a card with the [bi]Skill[/bi] trait and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

A.name: Feast of Plenty
A.text:
Feast of Plenty's resource cost must be paid from a single hero's resource pool.

Action: Ready up to 3 heroes and add 1 resource to each of their resource pools. Only 1 copy of Feast of Plenty can be played by the players each round.

A.name: Deeping Defender
A.text: Response: After Deeping Defender defends an attack, return the attacking enemy to the staging area and deal 1 damage to it.

A.name: Morwen Steelsheen
A.text:
Action: Put Morwen Steelsheen into play from your hand. Then, discard a [bi]Rohan[/bi] or [bi]Gondor[/bi] ally you control.

Response: After a [bi]Rohan[/bi] or [bi]Gondor[/bi] ally leaves play, exhaust Morwen Steelsheen to either heal 2 damage from a character or reduce your threat by 1.

A.name: It Should Be Spared
A.text: Response: After a [bi]Trap[/bi] card you control attaches to an enemy, return it to your hand. Then, play it from your hand for no cost.

A.name: Spring the Trap
A.text: Response: After a [bi]Trap[/bi] card you control attaches to an enemy, put a [bi]Ranger[/bi] ally into play from your hand.

A.name: Squire of the Mark
A.text: Response: After a [bi]Rohan[/bi] ally you control is discarded from play, add Squire of the Mark to the victory display to put that ally into play exhausted.

A.name: Rammas Lookout
A.text: While each hero you control has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Rammas Lookout gets +1 [willpower] and does not exhaust to quest.

A.name: Theodwyn
A.text: Response: After Theodwyn enters play, either draw 1 card or add 1 resource to a [bi]Noble[/bi] hero's resource pool.

A.name: Light-footed Steed
A.text:
Attach to a [bi]Rohan[/bi] hero. Restricted.

Response: After a character you control leaves play, exhaust Light-footed Steed to ready attached hero. Then, if the character that left play was unique, attached hero gets +1 [attack] until the end of the round.

A.name: Rammas Sentry
A.text: While each hero you control has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Rammas Sentry gains: "Response: Cancel 1 point of damage just dealt to a [bi]Gondor[/bi] character. (Limit once per phase.)"

A.name: Live Bait
A.text:
Play only if you control an unattached [bi]Trap[/bi] attachment.  

Action: Choose a non-unique enemy in play. Until the end of the round, treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [bi]Traits[/bi]). Then, attach an unattached [bi]Trap[/bi] attachment you control to that enemy.

A.name: Worthy of Remembrance
A.text: Combat Action: Discard a [bi]Rohan[/bi] ally you control to choose an enemy. Deal 2 damage to that enemy (4 damage instead if the ally was unique).

A.name: Need Brooks No Delay
A.text:
Reduce the cost to play Need Brooks No Delay by 1 for each [bi]Rohan[/bi] hero you control.

Planning Action: Search the top 10 cards of your deck for a card with printed cost 2 or less (3 or less if it is unique) and set it aside. Shuffle your deck. Then, play the set aside card for no cost as if it were in your hand.

A.name: Wild Country
A.text: Forced: At the end of the travel phase, if the active location is not vast, each player deals 1 damage to a character they control.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the active location is vast, deal 1 damage to the defending character.

A.name: Endless Grasslands
A.text: Forced: At the end of the travel phase, if the active location is not vast, each player exhausts an ally they control.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the active location is vast, the attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

A.name: Windworn Villages
A.text: Forced: At the end of the travel phase, if the active location is not vast, each player chooses and discards 1 card from their hand.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the active location is vast, discard 1 attachment from the defending character.

A.name: Humpbacked Downs
A.text: Forced: At the end of the travel phase, if the active location is not vast, each player raises their threat by 1.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the active location is vast, raise your threat by 2.

A.name: Ride Through the Night
A.text: When Revealed: Exhaust all restricted attachments the players control. If no restricted attachments were exhausted this way, Ride Through the Night gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the active location is vast, the defending character cannot ready until the end of the round.

A.name: The Green Sea
A.text:
Vast locations get +3 quest points and are immune to player card effects.

Forced: At the beginning of the travel phase, if there are no vast locations in the staging area, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a vast location is discarded and add it to the staging area.

A.name: Cold from the Mountains
A.text: When Revealed: Each player that controls more than 2 allies must discard an ally they control (discard 2 instead if they control more than 5).
A.shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.

A.name: Exhausting Winds
A.text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each character with more than 1 remaining hit point. Exhaust each character not damaged this way.
A.shadow: Shadow: After this attack, deal X damage to the defending character. X is 1 less than the character's remaining hit points.

A.name: Tired and Hungry
A.text:
While attached to a hero, counts as a [bi]Condition[/bi] attachment with the text: "Forced: After a location is explored, exhaust attached hero."

When Revealed: Attach to a ready hero without a copy of Tired and Hungry. Otherwise, Tired and Hungry gains surge.

A.name: Exposed to the Elements
A.text: Forced: At the end of the staging step, discard cards from the encounter deck until a treachery card is discarded. Reveal that card.

A.name: Old Farmhouse
A.text: Forced: After Old Farmhouse leaves play as an explored location, discard cards from the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Add that location to the staging area.

A.name: Abandoned Mill
A.keywords: Doomed 1. Immune to player card effects.
A.text: Forced: After Abandoned Mill leaves play as an explored location, discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.

A.name: Dunland Chieftain
A.text: Forced: After Dunland Chieftain engages you, discard 1 random card from your hand. Then, discard each other copy of that card that is in your hand or under your control.

A.name: Wild Ravager
A.text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, choose a random player. Wild Ravager engages that player.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy cannot take damage until the end of the round.

A.name: Dunlending Berserker
A.text: Forced: After Dunlending Berserker engages you, deal 1 damage to a hero you control and 1 damage to a non-unique enemy engaged with you.

A.name: Hillman Scout
A.text: Forced: After Hillman Scout engages you, exhaust the ready ally you control with the highest printed cost.
A.shadow: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control with 3 or more [attack].

A.name: Surprise Attack
A.text: When Revealed: The next enemy engaged this round cannot take damage until the end of the round and returns to the staging area after it attacks this round.

A.name: A History of Strife
A.text: Each [bi]Dunland[/bi] enemy gains "Forced: After this enemy engages you, discard a resource from a hero you control."

A.name: Recreant Rider
A.text: Forced: When Recreant Rider enters the staging area, it makes an immediate attack against the first player.
A.shadow: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

A.name: Deadly Defector
A.text: Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if Deadly Defector is in the staging area, it makes an immediate attack against the last player.
A.shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is in the staging area, it makes an additional attack after this one.

A.name: Orc Battalion
A.text:
Orc Battalion cannot take combat damage while being attacked by fewer than 3 characters.

Forced: After a character is declared as an attacker against Orc Batallion, deal 1 damage to that character.

A.name: Servant of the Eye
A.text: Forced: When Servant of the Eye attacks you, raise your threat by 1.
A.shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 2.

A.name: Black Land Scouts
A.text: Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, either raise each player's threat by 1 or deal 4 damage among characters in play.
A.shadow: Shadow: Deal 2 damage among characters you control.

A.name: Orcish Horse-butcher
A.text: Forced: When Orcish Horse-butcher deals damage to a character, either discard an attachment from that character or raise the engaged player's threat by 1.
A.shadow: Shadow: Either discard an attachment you control or raise your threat by 3.

A.name: Crimson Banner
A.text:
While attached to an enemy, counts as a [bi]Condition[/bi] attachment with the text: "Forced: At the end of the round, each player raises their threat by 1 for each [bi]Orc[/bi] enemy in play."

When Revealed: Attach to the non-unique [bi]Orc[/bi] enemy with the highest engagement cost.

A.name: White Mountain Reinforcements
A.text:
When Revealed: Each player not engaged with an enemy must search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and put it into play engaged with them. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Each shadow card with no shadow effect gains: "Shadow: Raise your threat by 1."

A.name: Brigand Ringleader
A.keywords: Looter 3. Immune to player card effects. Cannot take more than 5 damage each round.
A.text: Forced: At the end of the round, the engaged player adds the top card of their deck to Brigand Ringleader's loot pile and heals 1 damage from Brigand Ringleader for each different card cost in its loot pile.

A.name: Plundered Goods
A.text:
Add 1 to the total [threat] in the staging area for each card in Plundered Goods' loot pile.

Forced: When an enemy leaves play, add 1 card from its loot pile to Plundered Goods' loot pile, then add another card from its loot pile to its owner's hand. Discard the rest.

A.name: Pillaging Swordsman
A.text: Pillaging Swordsman gets +X [attack], where X is the highest printed cost among cards in its loot pile.
A.shadow: Shadow: Add the top 2 cards of your deck to the attacking enemy's loot pile.

A.name: Grasping Slaver
A.text:
Forced: After an ally is damaged or destroyed by Grasping Slaver's attack, add that ally to Grasping Slaver's loot pile.

Forced: After Grasping Slaver attacks, deal X damage among characters you control. X is the number of ally cards in Grasping Slaver's loot pile.

A.name: Vengeful Bowman
A.text: X is the number of different player card types in Vengeful Bowman's loot pile.
A.shadow: Shadow: If this attack deals damage, add the top card of your deck to attacking enemy's loot pile.

A.name: Sneaky Thief
A.text: Forced: When Sneaky Thief would take any amount of damage, if it has any cards in its loot pile, discard each of those cards instead.
A.shadow: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, attacking enemy makes an additional attack.

A.name: Erelas Gates
A.text: Travel: Each player must choose an enemy and add the top card of their deck to that enemy's loot pile.
A.shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each card in the attacking enemy's loot pile.

A.name: Crossroads
A.text: Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards until an enemy is discarded. Put that enemy into play engaged with the first player.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X [attack], where X is the number of different spheres among cards in its loot pile.

A.name: Erelas Stables
A.text: Travel: Return an enemy engaged with a player to the staging area.
A.shadow: Shadow: If attacking enemy is non-unique, return it to the staging area after this attack.

A.name: Chaos in the Hills
A.text: When Revealed: Return the engaged enemy with the highest engagement cost to the staging area. If no enemy was returned to the staging area this way, Chaos in the Hills gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: After this attack, attacking enemy engages the next player and makes an immediate attack.

A.name: Looted Weapons
A.text:
While attached to an enemy, counts as a [bi]Condition[/bi] attachment with the text: "Attached enemy gets +1 [threat] and +1 [attack] for each attachment in its loot pile."

When Revealed: Attach to the enemy in play with the highest engagement cost. Then, each player adds an [bi]Item[/bi] attachment they control to that enemy's loot pile, if able. If there are no enemies in play, Looted Weapons gains surge.

A.name: Stockpile Barricade
A.text:
Each enemy gets +1 [defense] for each attachment in its loot pile. 

Forced: After resolving the Looter keyword on an enemy, if there are no attachments in that enemy's loot pile, it makes an immediate attack against the engaged player.

A.name: Erelas Beacon
A.text:
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon for each enemy in the staging area.

[b]Erelas Beacon has X hit points, where X is equal to 2, plus 3[pp]. If Erelas Beacon has no hit points remaining, the players lose the game.[/b]

A.name: Host of Rohan
A.text: Action: The players as a group may spend 2 resources to ready Host of Rohan. (Limit once per phase.)

A.name: Enraged Dunlending
A.text: Forced: After Enraged Dunlending engages you, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.
A.shadow: Shadow: Any damage dealt to the defending character by this attack is instead dealt to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Bald Hill
A.text:
While the players control the beacon, Bald Hill gets +3 [threat].

Travel: If the players control the beacon, deal 2 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Wooden Barricade
A.text: While Wooden Barricade is in the staging area, it gains: "Forced: At the end of the combat phase, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon and place 1 progress on Wooden Barricade."
A.shadow: Shadow: Either discard 2 attachments you control or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Rocky Slope
A.text:
After an encounter card effect is canceled, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

Travel: The first player must discard all event cards from their hand.
A.shadow: Shadow: Either discard all resources from each hero you control or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Surrounding Grassland
A.text: Forced: After Surrounding Grassland leaves play as an explored location, if there are no copies of Surrounding Grassland in the staging area, return this location to the staging area.

A.name: Narrow Stair
A.text:
Each player cannot declare more than 1 attack and cannot declare more than 1 attacker each phase.

While Narrow Stair is the active location, each player cannot defend more than 1 attack each phase (other attacks are undefended).
A.shadow: Shadow: Either attacking enemy gets +3 [attack] or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: From All Sides
A.text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: either deal 1 damage to 4 different characters you control or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.
A.shadow: Shadow: After this attack, either discard the defending character or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Another Wave
A.text: When Revealed: If the players control the beacon, either deal 2 damage to Erelas Beacon or reveal an encounter card.
A.shadow: Shadow: Either the attacking enemy makes an additional attack or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Assault Upon Erelas
A.text: When Revealed: The first player chooses an enemy engaged with a player and returns it to the staging area. If no enemy was returned to the staging area this way, either deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon or Assault Upon Erelas gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: Either raise your threat by 4 or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

A.name: Reclaim the Beacon
A.text:
The Dunlendings control the beacon. Enemies in the staging area cannot be optionally engaged or take damage.

Cannot have more than X progress, where X is equal to 2, plus 1[pp]. If Reclaim the Beacon has X progress on it, flip it over (keeping all progress).

B.name: Defend the Beacon
B.text:
The players control the beacon. Shadow cards are immune to player card effects.

Cannot have more than X progress, where X is equal to 2, plus 1[pp].

Response: Remove any amount of progress from Defend the Beacon to cancel an equal amount of damage just dealt to Erelas Beacon. Then, if Defend the Beacon has 0 progress, flip it over.

A.name: Stolen Steeds
A.text:
[bi]Mount[/bi] objectives cannot be discarded or leave play. If a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective is not attached, a player must claim it and attach it to a hero they control.

Forced: At the end of the round, add 1 progress to the main quest for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective the players control. Then, raise each player's threat by 1 for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective in play the players do not control.

A.name: Flinthoof
A.text:
The enemy guarding Flinthoof gets +1 [attack].

Attached hero gets +1 [attack].

Combat Action: Exhaust Flinthoof to deal 1 damage to an enemy in play.

A.name: Brightmane
A.text:
The location or enemy guarding Brightmane gets +1 [threat]. 

Attached hero gets +1 [willpower].

Quest Action: Exhaust Brightmane to look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is a location, you may discard it.

A.name: Felarof
A.text:
Forced: When the enemy guarding Felarof attacks, deal it 2 additional shadow cards.

Combat Action: Exhaust Felarof to discard a facedown shadow card from play.

A.name: Thruk
A.text:
Thruk engages the first player. 

Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, if Thruk is not guarding an objective, he makes an immediate attack against the engaged player.

A.name: Saddle-slasher
A.text: X is equal to 2, plus 1 for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective the players control.
A.shadow: Shadow: If you control a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective, either attach it to the attacking enemy as a guarded objective or discard the defending character after this attack resolves.

A.name: Rein-ripper
A.text: Forced: When Rein-ripper attacks, deal it two additional shadow cards. You may attach a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective you control to Rein-ripper as a guarded objective to cancel this effect.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective the players control.

A.name: Bridle-biter
A.text: When Revealed: Bridle-biter engages the player who controls the most [bi]Mount[/bi] objectives.
A.shadow: Shadow: Put Bridle-biter into play engaged with you and deal it a shadow card.

A.name: Pommel-pouncer
A.text: While Pommel-pouncer is in the staging area without a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective attached, it gains: "Forced: When a player would gain control of a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective, attach that [bi]Mount[/bi] objective to Pommel-pouncer as a guarded objective instead."

A.name: Spoiled Pasture
A.text:
X is equal to 2, plus 2 for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective the players control.

Forced: After a player loses control of a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective, raise their threat by 1.
A.shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1 for each [bi]Mount[/bi] objective you control.

A.name: Horse Thieves' Hovel
A.text:
When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to a non-vast location.

Forced: After Horse Thieves' Hovel leaves play as an explored location, if there are fewer than 1[pp] enemies in play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add that enemy to the staging area.

A.name: Horse Lord's Lodge
A.text:
When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to a non-vast location.

Forced: After Horse Lord's Lodge leaves play as an explored location, if there are fewer than 1[pp] locations in play, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Add that location to the staging area.

A.name: Thirst for Horse Blood
A.text: When Revealed: Each player who controls a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective chooses: either reveal an encounter card, or choose the enemy with the highest engagement cost without an attachment and attach a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective you control to that enemy as a guarded objective. If no player controls a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective, Thirst for Horse Blood gains surge.

A.name: Overburdened
A.text: When Revealed: Each player who controls more than 2 attachments must discard 1 attachment they control, if able (discard 2 attachments instead, if able, if they control more than 5 attachments). If no attachments were discarded this way, Overburdened gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 random card from your hand.

A.name: The Last Alliance
A.text:
Choose two traits, [bi]A[/bi] and [bi]B[/bi]. Each of your starting heroes and each ally in your deck must have either the printed [bi]A[/bi] or [bi]B[/bi] trait, but cannot have both. You must have at least 1 starting hero and 10 allies in your deck with each trait.

Setup: Flip this card over.

B.name: The Last Alliance
B.text:
While you control more [bi]A[/bi] characters than [bi]B[/bi][nobr]characters, reduce the cost of the first [bi]B[/bi][nobr]ally you play this round by 1, and vice versa.

Action: Exhaust The Last Alliance to choose a card in your hand or a card in play under your control. Replace each printed instance of "[bi]A[/bi]" or "[bi]B[/bi]" in that card's ability text with "[bi]A[/bi] or [bi]B[/bi]" until the end of the round.

A.name: Drive them Away
A.text: Setup: Set Brigand Ringleader aside, out of play. Add Plundered Goods to the staging area. Each player searches the encounter deck for a different enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Drive them Away
B.text:
Forced: After an enemy is destroyed, place 1 resource token here.

Encounter Action: Remove 5 progress from this stage to choose a card in a loot pile and discard it. Limit once per round per player.

[b]The players cannot advance unless there are X resource tokens on this stage, where X is equal to 1, plus 2[pp] (2 per player).[/b]

A.name: Ambush!
A.text: When Revealed: End the current phase. Add Brigand Ringleader to the staging area. Each player not engaged with an enemy searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy to put into play and engages it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Ambush!
B.text:
Forced: After an enemy enters play, it makes engagement checks.

Planning Action: Remove 5 progress from this stage to choose a card in a loot pile. The owner of that card may either discard it or play it for no cost. Limit four times per round for the group.

[b]When Brigand Ringleader is defeated, the players win the game.[/b]

A.name: Battle for the Hill
A.text: Setup: Set Host of Rohan aside, out of play. Add Erelas Beacon and 1[pp] Enraged Dunlendings to the staging area. Add the double-sided side quest to the staging area, Reclaim the Beacon side faceup. Search the encounter deck for 1 copy of Surrounding Grassland and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Battle for the Hill
B.text:
Forced: After placing any amount of progress on this stage, each player must choose: either exhaust a character you control or deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

[b]This stage cannot be completed while the Dunlendings control the beacon.[/b]

A.name: Hold the Hilltop
A.text: When Revealed: Place progress on Defend the Beacon (bypassing the active location) until it has X progress on it, where X is equal to 2, plus 1[pp]. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to the staging area.

B.name: Hold the Hilltop
B.text:
Time 3.

Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon (2 damage instead if there are 3 or more players in the game). Then, if there are no time counters on this stage, immediately advance to stage 3.

Forced: After Defend the Beacon is chosen as the current quest, reveal an encounter card.

[b]If the Dunlendings control the beacon, the players lose the game.[/b]

A.name: The Last Push
A.text: When Revealed: Remove all progress from Defend the Beacon and flip it over. Put Host of Rohan into play under the first player's control. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to the staging area.

B.name: The Last Push
B.text:
Add 2 to the total [threat] in the staging area for each damage on Erelas Beacon. 

Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, each engaged enemy makes an immediate attack.

Forced: After a character leaves play, deal 1 damage to Erelas Beacon.

[b]At the end of the round, if the Dunlendings control the beacon, the players lose the game, and if the players control the beacon, they win the game.[/b]

A.name: Thieves and Coursers
A.text: Setup: Add Stolen Steeds to the staging area. Set Thruk, the [bi]Mount[/bi] objectives, and the 8 enemies from the Orc-host encounter set aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck. The first player reveals Flinthoof and Brightmane and adds them to the staging area. Then, each other player discards cards from the encounter deck until a location or enemy is discarded and adds it to the staging area.

B.name: Thieves and Coursers
B.text:
[b]This stage cannot be defeated unless the players control 2 [bi]Mount[/bi]
objectives.[/b]

A.name: The King's Stallion
A.text: When Revealed: If it is the combat phase, end the phase. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. The first player adds Thruk to the staging area, guarding Felarof. Each other player discards cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and puts that enemy into play engaged with them.

B.name: The King's Stallion
B.text:
Thruk cannot take damage unless there are at least 4 progress tokens on this stage.

[b]This stage cannot be defeated unless the players control 3 [bi]Mount[/bi]
objectives.[/b]

A.name: The Sweeping Tide
A.text: When Revealed: If it is the combat phase, end the phase. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Search the victory display for Thruk and add him to the staging area. Each player chooses 2 enemies from the set-aside Orc-host encounter cards and puts those enemies into play engaged with them. One of the enemies put into play this way must be Orc Battalion.

B.name: The Sweeping Tide
B.text:
Skip the staging step. If the encounter deck is ever empty, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

Forced: When an enemy makes an attack, deal it an additional shadow card.

[b]If a [bi]Mount[/bi] objective is attached to an enemy, the players lose the game. If there are no enemies in play, the players win the game.[/b]

A.text:

B.name: Back Card
B.text:
The countryside of Rohan buzzes with rumors of vanished horses and Dunlendings slipping across the Isen like phantoms. Though the brave and cunning heroes of this story begin their journey as a simple honor guard for the queen of Rohan, they will soon find themselves in the midst of danger, intrigue, and all-out war. Your fellowship will battle from the Beacon of Erelas and across the Eastfold in pursuit of dangerous hillmen and worse. But to what end are they striking at Rohan's borders, and what price will you have to pay for peace?

[center][img custom/Image-Expansion-Design-Core-Set.png 1.5in][/center]

[center][img custom/Image-Affiliation-Copyright.png 2.1in][/center]

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
[defaultsize 6.75][img custom/Header-The-Horse-Lords-Ire.png 1.29in]
[b]Difficulty level = 5[/b]

In the darkness:
"Do what you are bidden, Ossian."
The soldier grimaced. "My lord, he is one of us. I fought at his side at Amon Hen. He saved my life."
"Remember what we are fighting for, my boy. Go now. For the Gift."
He steeled himself. "For the Gift."

That morning, you were roused from an unsteady sleep by Ealdwulf himself. The crags of his face were licked by shadow. All else was darkness. "It is not yet dawn," he said. "I have ill news."

"What tidings, master Ealdwulf?" said one of the heroes.

"A rider of Rohan has turned himself in," said the old lord. "For the slaughter at Erelas. For treason." The word hit like a hammer. "He has told the guards that the rest of his comrades will move to depose Lord Eomund before dawn. That even our trusted spymaster has turned against us in service of a devilish conspiracy."

"We must go to the guards," said a hero, lacing her hauberk. "Perhaps we can wring some details from this prisoner."

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
"I feel the noose ever-tightening," said Ealdwulf. "The traitors are within the walls now. Better not to tip our hand that we have become aware of their duplicity. My friends, root out this duplicity or the Eastmark shall surely crumble from within -- and with it, the soul of Rohan."

With that, the heroes outfitted themselves and made their way to the quiet streets of Aldburg. "Shall we go to the barracks, then?" said one.

As they passed by a seamy tavern called The Horse's Tail, they caught a whisper of hushed conversation. "Assassin?" said one of the patrons. "In Aldburg?"

"Tavern or barracks," said a hero. "Shall we toss a coin?"

"The Aldburg Plot" is played with an encounter deck built with all the cards from the following encounter sets: The Aldburg Plot, Faithless Rohirrim, and Rohan Encampment. These sets are indicated by the following icons:

[center][img custom/Encounter-Icons-Ambush-at-Erelas.png 1.28in][/center]

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
[center][img custom/Do-Not-Read-the-Following.png 1.45in][/center]

Racing into the halls of Lord Eomund, the heroes were greeted by the Marshal of the Mark, the young Lord Eomund. He wore a scowl on his face, his blade unsheathed across his lap. Beside him sat the wizened Ealdwulf, his eyes bleary and sleepless. At the heroes' entrance, the man leapt to his feet.

"What news?" said Ealdwulf. "Come, what news?"

"Yes," said Eomund. "Tell us which captain's head shall be cloven, and let us be done with it."

"Patience, my lord." Ealdwulf knelt at his lord's feet. "Surely they have found something. Friends, tell us what you have learned."

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
If the heroes control the Raven Signet Ring objective:
"I have seen this ring before," said Eomund. "On the knuckle of a Dunlending warchief. How came it into the spy master's possession?"

"Perhaps a token from the warchief to one of his traitorous collaborators," said Ealdwulf.

If the heroes control the Rohirric Coins objective:
"What's the meaning of these coins?" said one of the heroes. "A stranger dropped them for us in the tavern."

"Perhaps he mistook you for one of the Whisperer's agents," said Eomund. "Your appearance is strange enough."

If the heroes control the Prison Key objective:
"You retrieved this from the spy master, then?" said Eomund. "So we can be certain he was behind the prisoner's murder. Does this conspiracy extend further?"

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
If the heroes control the Silver Dagger objective:
"I recognize this blade," said Ealdwulf.

"As do I," said one of the heroes. "At Erelas, Galmod wielded it against a captive Dunlending. I thought perhaps it was a fit of rage, but is it possible he meant only to silence a man who could have betrayed his secret?"

If the heroes control the Ruby Cloak-pin objective:
"We found this among the ashes in the western quarter," said one of the heroes. "We know it well. This belonged to Galmod. But of him we have found no trace."

If the heroes control the Letter from Dunland objective:
Ealdwulf read the missive aloud: "Straw-hair Galmod, we have made war against the Erelas hill of flame. Our pact remains unfulfilled. Return the land of green hills to my people, as you have oathsworn. Grimrede."

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
If the heroes control the Traitor's Confession objective:
"The killer Ossian was one of Galmod's most trusted lieutenants," said Ealdwulf. "Doubtless he hoped to eliminate the prisoner before he spoke the truth of what happened at Erelas."

If the heroes control the Red Fletched Arrow objective:
"The armorer claims he was instructed to create this for Galmod," said one of the heroes. "What could this be for?"

"It was meant for his assassin's bow," said Eomund. "And my heart."

Conclusion
With your evidence laid before the Marshal, the young lord Eomund summons his guards. "Bring me Galmod in chains. He will not live to see morning."

A.name: Fatty Bolger
A.text:
Setup: Reduce your threat by 2.

Response: Raise your threat by 4 and exhaust [name] to cancel a non-unique enemy card just revealed from the encounter deck and add it to the victory display. (Limit once per game for the group.)

A.name: Widfast
A.text:
Setup: Search your deck for a [bi]Creature[/bi] ally, add it to your hand, and shuffle your deck. For the first round, reduce its cost by 2.

Travel Action: If there is one active location, spend 1 resource from Widfast's pool to travel to another location (resolving its [b]Travel[/b] effect). There are now two active locations.

A.name: A Lesson in Caution
A.text: Action: Draw 1 card. Then, either reduce your threat by 2, or the next card you play this phase gains secrecy 1.

A.name: Lily Cotton
A.text: Action: Exhaust Lily Cotton to ready a different [bi]Hobbit[/bi] ally and add Lily Cotton's [willpower], [attack], and [defense] to that ally's [willpower], [attack], and [defense] respectively until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, return that ally to your hand. (Limit once per phase.)

A.name: Back for Seconds
A.text: Response: After a [bi]Hobbit[/bi] ally leaves play, put it into play under any player's control.

A.name: Horn of Buckland
A.text:
Attach to a [lore] or [bi]Hobbit[/bi] hero.

Response: After you engage an enemy that shares a [bi]Trait[/bi] with an enemy in the victory display, exhaust [name] to ready attached hero. Then, that enemy gets -1 [attack] and -1 [defense] until the end of the round.

A.name: Weep no More!
A.text:
Limit 3 copies of [name] in the victory display.

Response: After a "when revealed" effect or a shadow effect on a treachery card resolves, add [name] to the victory display to add that card to the victory display.

A.name: Fear! Fire! Foes!
A.text:
Play only if you do not control a [bi]Warrior[/bi] hero.

Action: Choose a non-unique enemy and an attribute ([threat], [attack], or [defense]). Until the end of the phase, reduce the chosen attribute of that enemy to 0.

A.name: Buckland Shirriff
A.text: Response: After an enemy that shares a [bi]Trait[/bi] with an enemy in the victory display is added to the staging area, spend 1 [lore] resource to put [name] into play from your hand, under your control.

A.name: Young Tom
A.text: During the round that [name] enters play, enemies get +5 engagement cost.

A.name: Gavin
A.text:
Cannot have attachments.

Response: After resolving the staging of an encounter card without surge, exhaust Gavin to give that card surge and add 1 resource to the pool of a [bi]Scout[/bi] hero you control. If the next encounter card revealed is not a location, discard it without resolving its effects.

A.name: Evil Under the Moon
A.text: Setup: Set each encounter side quest, each copy of Town Guard, and each copy of Dunlending Agents aside, out of play. Set each double-sided encounter card aside, out of play, [bi]Clue[/bi] side facedown. Add Garrison Barracks and The Horse's Tail to the staging area. Search the encounter deck for an enemy (2 different enemies instead if there are 3 or more players) and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Evil Under the Moon
B.text:
Enemies cannot be optionally engaged. 

Forced: At the end of the round, raise each player's threat by 1.

The players cannot advance unless they control a [bi]Clue[/bi] objective.

B.name: Gathering Clues
B.text: [b]Response[/b]: At the end of the round, if the players control at least 4 [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives, they may advance to stage 3A.

A.name: The Uncertain Dawn
A.text: When Revealed: Remove all [bi]Suspicious[/bi] cards and encounter side quests from the game. Add any set aside [bi]Dunland[/bi] or [bi]Garrison[/bi] enemies to the staging area, if able.

B.name: The Uncertain Dawn
B.text:
The Uncertain Dawn gets -5 quest points for each [bi]Clue[/bi] objective the players control.

Action: Exhaust a [bi]Clue[/bi] objective to give attached hero +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] or +1 [defense] until the end of the phase. 

Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Reveal that enemy and add it to the staging area. 

[b]At the end of the round, if The Uncertain Dawn has no remaining quest points, the players win the game.[/b]

A.name: Red Harvest
A.text:
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, that player deals 2 damage to a character they control.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Each player discards cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to the staging area. Add The Armoury to the staging area.

A.name: The Prisoner in White
A.text:
The players may not travel to locations or make locations the active location by player card effects.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, add Ossian to the staging area.

A.name: The Man with the Twisted Lip
A.printname: The Man with the Twisted Lip
A.text:
Forced: At the end of the round, raise each player's threat by 1.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, add The Spy Master to the staging area.

A.name: A Fire Rises
A.text:
Increase the cost to play each event by 1.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, reveal Spreading Inferno.

A.name: A Case of Identity
A.text:
Forced: At the end of the staging step, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Reveal that enemy.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, add Great Mead Hall to the staging area.

A.name: Whisperer in the Darkness
A.text:
Forced: After a location is explored, raise each player's threat by 1.

Forced: After this stage is defeated, add The Whisperer to the staging area.

A.name: Garrison Barracks
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. X is twice the number of [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives controlled by the players. 

Travel: Shuffle all set aside non-unique [bi]Dunland[/bi] enemies into the encounter deck. 

Forced: When Garrison Barracks is explored, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Raven Signet Ring
B.text:
When Revealed: Add The Man with the Twisted Lip to the staging area.

If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, discard all resources in its resource pool.

A.name: The Horse's Tail
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. X is twice the number of [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives controlled by the players.

Travel: Shuffle all set aside [bi]Garrison[/bi] enemies into the encounter deck.

Forced: When The Horse's Tail is explored, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Rohirric Coins
B.text:
When Revealed: Add Whisperer in the Darkness to the staging area.

If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, exhaust another character you control.

A.name: The Armoury
A.text:
Immune to player card effects.

Travel: Each player must exhaust the ready character they control with the highest [defense].

Forced: When The Armoury is explored, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Red Fletched Arrow
B.text:
If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, raise your threat by 1.

A.name: The Whisperer
A.text:
Forced: At the end of the round, return [name] to the staging area, if able. [name] makes an immediate attack against the first player. Damage that would be dealt by this attack is instead assigned as an increase to your threat.

Forced: When [name] is defeated, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Silver Dagger
B.text:
When Revealed: Add A Case of Identity and Red Harvest to the staging area.

If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, deal 1 damage to it.

A.name: The Spy Master
A.text:
Forced: When [name] is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, deal 1 damage to the defending character and deal [name] another shadow card (limit twice per attack).

Forced: When [name] is defeated, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Prison Key
B.text:
When Revealed: Add A Fire Rises and The Prisoner in White to the staging area.

If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, discard a non-[bi]Clue[/bi] attachment from it.

A.name: Spreading Inferno
A.text:
Forced: At the end of the quest phase, discard the attached location, raise each player's threat by 1, and discard the lowest cost ally controlled by each player. Then, reveal [name].

Forced: When the attached location is explored, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Ruby Cloak-pin
B.text:
If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

A.name: Great Mead Hall
A.text:
Immune to player card effects.

Travel: The players must raise their threat by X where X is the number of enemies in the staging area.

Forced: When Great Mead Hall is explored, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Letter from Dunland
B.text:
If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, discard 2 progress from each location and quest card.

A.name: Ossian
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. [name] cannot take more than X damage each round, where X is the number of [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives controlled by the players.

Forced: When [name] is defeated, flip this card over and reveal it.

B.name: Traitor's Confession
B.text:
If unattached, attach to the hero with the fewest [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives attached.

Forced: After attached hero readies, discard a card at random from your hand.

A.name: Town Guard
A.text:
If the players control 2 or more [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives, [name] gets +2 [threat].

Forced: After [name] attacks and destroys a character, discard 1 resource from each hero you control with a [bi]Clue[/bi] objective.

A.name: Dunlending Agents
A.text:
If the players control 2 or more [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives, [name] gets +2 [attack].

Forced: After [name] attacks and destroys a character you control, deal 1 damage to each hero you control with a [bi]Clue[/bi] objective.

A.name: Aldburg Malcontent
A.text: When Revealed: If the players control 3 or more [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives, [name] gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the players control 2 or more [bi]Clue[/bi] objectives, return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

A.name: Misty Street
A.text:
When Revealed: Discard all attachments and tokens from the highest cost ally the first player controls and attach that ally facedown under [name]. 

Forced: After [name] is explored, return the attached ally to its owner's control, faceup and ready.
A.shadow: Shadow: Discard one non-[bi]Clue[/bi] attachment you control.

A.name: Well-lit Hall
A.text: While [name] is in the staging area, no more than 3 progress can be placed on a quest card as a result of questing successfully.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if defending character has a [bi]Clue[/bi] attachment).

A.name: Decrepit Hovel
A.text: Ally resource costs must be paid from a single hero's resource pool.
A.shadow: Shadow: Discard 1 resource from a hero you control.

A.name: Taken by the Night
A.text: When Revealed: Each player must discard the lowest printed cost ally they control. If no allies with a printed cost of 2 or higher were discarded this way, [name] gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if this enemy is attacking from the staging area)

A.name: False Lead
A.text:
Doomed 1.

When Revealed: Each player removes a hero they control with an attached [bi]Clue[/bi] objective from the quest, if able. Then, each player exhausts a hero they control that is not committed to the quest.

A.name: Sudden Ambush
A.text: When Revealed: The first player must choose: Either raise your threat by 4, or the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile engages you and makes an immediate attack. You must declare the ready character you control with the highest [willpower] as the defender for this attack, if able.
A.shadow: Shadow: Resolve this card's "when revealed" effect.

A.name: Alagos
A.text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.

Response: After a player gains control of an [bi]Eagle[/bi] ally, add 1 resource to the pool of a hero that player controls. Limit once per round.

A.name: Faunith
A.text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.

Quest Action: Play an [bi]Eagle[/bi] ally from your hand. Then, you may exhaust that ally to either commit it to the quest or deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

A.name: Veteran Eagle
A.text:
Cannot have restriced attachments.

Response: After you gain control of [name], each copy of [name] you control gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

A.name: Chieftain of the Skies
A.text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.

Response: After you gain control of [name], ready an ally you control.

A.name: Messenger of Manwe
A.text:
Cannot defend or have restricted attachments.

Response: After you gain control of [name], give an [bi]Eagle[/bi] or [bi]Noble[/bi] hero you control +1 [Willpower] until the end of the round.

Response: After [name] commits to the quest, either ready it or give control of it to another player.

A.name: Roving Herbmaster
A.text: Response: After a player reduces their threat, heal 1 damage from a character you control. Then, you may give control of [name] to another player.  Limit once per phase.

A.name: Hidden Roosts
A.text: Response: When an Eagle ally leaves play, that ally's controller reduces their threat by X, where X is the printed cost of the ally. If X is 2 or less, that player also draws 1 card.

A.name: Breath of Arda
A.text: Encounter Action: Return X [bi]Eagle[/bi] allies you own (under any player's control) to your hand. Then, put each of those allies into play under any player's control, one at a time. Remove Breath of Arda from the game.

A.name: Grip
A.text:
Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost.

Response: After [name] enters play, spend 1 resource to search your deck for a [bi]Creature[/bi] ally with printed cost 2 or less and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.

A.name: Fang
A.text:
Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost.

Response: After [name] enters play, spend 1 resource to search your deck for a [bi]Creature[/bi] ally with printed cost 2 or less and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.

A.name: Wolf
A.text:
Limit 1 per deck. Cannot have attachments. Each enemy in play gets +1 engagement cost.

Response: After [name] enters play, spend 1 resource to search your deck for a [bi]Creature[/bi] ally with printed cost 2 or less and put it into play. Shuffle your deck.

A.name: Guided by Fate
A.text:
Attach to a hero. 

Response: When you would shuffle a card with the encounter keyword into the encounter deck, exhaust [name] to shuffle it into the top 5 cards instead.

Action: Exhaust [name] to shuffle a card in the encounter deck discard pile with the encounter keyword into the top 5 cards of the encounter deck.

A.name: Golden Crown
A.text:
Attach to an [bi]Eagle[/bi] hero. Attached hero gains the [bi]Noble[/bi] trait.
Action: Exhaust [name] to choose an [bi]Eagle[/bi] ally you own under any player's control. Either give control of that ally to a different player, or discard it from play to add 1 resource to the attached hero's pool.

A.name: Poachers in the Night
A.text: Setup: Set Shores of Anduin, Orc Battalion, and Morgahk aside out of play. Make a copy of Pillaged Stables the active location. Add Wild Steeds, Captured Steeds, and a copy of Eastemnet Pastures to the staging area. Place 3[pp] steeds on Wild Steeds.

B.name: Poachers in the Night
B.text:
When Revealed: Each player discards cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. 
[b]This stage cannot be defeated while an enemy is in the staging area.[/b]

A.name: Relentless Forces
A.text: When Revealed: End the current phase. Shuffle the discard pile into the encounter deck. The first player adds Orc Battalion to the staging area. Each other player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to the staging area.

B.name: Relentless Forces
B.text:
Enemies get +10 engagement cost. 
Forced: At the end of the round, each enemy in the staging area captures its steeds. Place another steed from Wild Steeds on each of these enemies.
[b]This stage cannot be defeated while Orc Battalion is in play.[/b]

A.name: To the River!
A.text: When Revealed: End the current phase. Shuffle the discard pile into the encounter deck. The first player adds Shores of Anduin and Morghak to the staging area. Each other player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and adds that enemy to the staging area.

B.name: To the River!
B.text:
Enemies get +15 engagement cost. 
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, each enemy in the staging area captures their steeds. Place another steed from Wild Steeds on each of these enemies. Return every enemy to the staging area.

[b]The players cannot defeat this stage while Morgahk is in play. When the players defeat this stage, compare the number of steeds on Wild Steeds and Captured Steeds. If there are more steeds on Wild Steeds than Captured Steeds, the players win the game. Otherwise, the players lose the game.[/b]

A.name: Wild Steeds
A.text:
Forced: After an enemy enters play, place a steed from [name] on that enemy. 

Forced: When an enemy is defeated, return any steeds on that enemy to [name]. 

[b]If there are no steeds on [name] at the end of the round, the players lose the game.[/b]

A.name: Captured Steeds
A.text: Forced: When an enemy would leave play by any means other than being defeated, move any steeds from that enemy onto [name].

A.name: Morgahk
A.text:
Archery 3[pp] (5[pp] instead if there are more Wild Steeds than Captured Steeds). Immune to player card effects.

Forced: When [name] attacks, return the topmost enemy in the discard pile to the staging area.

A.name: White Mountain Beastmaster
A.text: Forced: After [name] engages you, either it makes an immediate attack, or it cannot take damage until the end of the round.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy cannot take damage until the end of the phase.

A.name: Orc Lookout
A.text: Forced: At the end of the combat phase, return [name] to the staging area.
A.shadow: Shadow: Return the attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

A.name: Orc Wrangler
A.text: Forced: After [name] attacks, move a steed from the active location to [name].
A.shadow: Shadow: Move a steed from the active location to the attacking enemy.

A.name: Shores of Anduin
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. Morgahk cannot be damaged.

Travel: Each enemy in play captures its steeds. Place a steed from Wild Steeds on each enemy in play.

Response: When this location leaves play as an explored location, each player may choose to immediately engage an enemy in the staging area.

A.name: Open Meadows
A.text: While [name] is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: At the end of the combat phase, place the topmost enemy from the encounter discard pile into the staging area."

A.name: Entwash Crossings
A.text: Travel: Discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Put that enemy into play engaged with the first player.

A.name: Eastemnet Pasture
A.text: Progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.

A.name: Pillaged Stables
A.text: Forced: At the end of the round, capture a steed on [name].
A.shadow: Shadow: The attacking enemy captures its steeds. Move a steed from Wild Steeds to that enemy.

A.name: Hidden Orc Camp
A.text:
[name] gets +1 [threat] for each steed token on it.
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, move a steed from a non-[bi]camp[/bi] location to this one.
Travel: Each player must exhaust a character to travel here.

A.name: Aggressive Poachers
A.text: When Revealed: Each player chooses to either move a steed from Wild Steeds to Captured Steeds, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and engage it. Shuffle the encounter deck if searched.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if there are more Wild Steeds than Captured Steeds).

A.name: Crackling Horse Whip
A.text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each ready character. If there are more Wild Steeds than Captured Steeds, [name] gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

A.name: Exhausted Pursuit
A.text: When Revealed: Each player chooses to either return an enemy engaged with them to the staging area, or exhaust each damaged character they control.

A.name: Expanded Search
A.text:
Enemies cannot be optionally engaged.

Forced: At the end of the staging step, if the number of location in the staging area is less than the number of players, discard cards from the encounter deck until a location is discarded. Add that location to the staging area.

A.name: Gaeronel
A.text: While the top card of your discard pile is an event, Gaeronel gets +2 [willpower], while it is an ally she gets +2 [attack], and while it is an attachment she gets +2 [defense].

A.name: Glorfindel
A.text:
Glorfindel gets +X [attack] while attacking alone, where X is the target's printed [defense].

Forced: After Glorfindel attacks alone, discard a card from your hand.

A.name: Harlond Shipwright
A.text: Harlond Shipwright gains +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] for each different card type among the top 3 cards of your discard pile.

A.name: Witness of the Fall
A.text:
If there are more than 3 cards in your hand, discard Witness of the Fall.

Response: After discarding any number of cards from your hand, exhaust Witness of the Fall to place one of those cards facedown underneath it.

Action: Return a card underneath Witness of the Fall to your hand. Limit 3 times per phase.

A.name: Gift of the Firstborn
A.text:
Attach to your threat dial.

Response: When an ally you control with the printed [bi]Noldor[/bi] or [bi]Silvan[/bi] trait would be discarded by its own card effect, keep it in play instead. Limit once per round per ally.

Forced: At the end of the round, increase your threat by 1.

A.name: Wandering Spirit
A.text:
Cannot enter play. 

Action: Either shuffle Wandering Spirit from your discard pile into your deck to draw a card, or move her up or down 1-2 spaces in your discard pile. You cannot trigger this ability if you have already triggered the ability of a Wandering Spirit this round.

A.name: Salvaged Supplies
A.text:
Salvaged Supplies can be played from your discard pile.

Action: If you have not shuffled a copy of Salvaged Supplies into your deck this round, shuffle Salvaged Supplies into your deck to choose a hero you control with 0 resources in their pool. Add 1 resource to that hero's pool.

A.name: Protected by Foresight
A.text:
Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. 
Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has 3 or more [willpower]).

A.name: Asfaloth
A.text:
Attach to a [bi]Noldor[/bi] or [bi]Silvan[/bi] character.
Action: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Asfaloth to draw 1 card (draw 2 cards instead if your hand is empty).

A.name: Relic of Nargothrond
A.text:
[name] can be played from your discard pile. Attach to a [bi]Noldor[/bi] or [bi]Dwarf[/bi] character. Limit 1 per character. Restricted.

Attached character gets +1 [defense].

Combat Action: Discard [name] to give attached character +2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

A.name: Memories of Gondolin
A.text:
Attach to a hero. While you have 3 or more cards in your hand, discard until you have 2 or fewer.

Action: Exhaust Memories of Gondolin to choose 1: Draw 2 cards, reduce your threat by 2, or ready attached hero. Then, choose a different option for each copy of Memories of Gondolin in your discard pile.

A.name: Galmod
A.text:
[b]When the last time counter is removed from [name], the players lose the game.[/b]

[b]If the players control [name], they win the game.[/b]

A.name: Giving Chase
A.text: Setup: Add Galmod and 1 copy of Snow Bank per player to the staging area.

B.name: Giving Chase
B.text: Characters cannot be readied by player card effects.

A.name: Biting Winds
A.text: When Revealed: Each player reveals an encounter card.  Treat the text box of each exhausted character as if it were blank (except for [bi]traits[/bi]) until the end of the round.

B.name: Biting Winds
B.text: Treat the text box of each exhausted character as if it were blank (except for [bi]traits[/bi]).

A.name: A Dangerous Pursuit
A.text: When Revealed: Each player reveals an encounter card.

B.name: A Dangerous Pursuit
B.text: Forced: at the beginning of the round, deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. A Dangerous Pursuit gets +4[pp] quest points.

A.name: Into the Storm
A.text: When Revealed: Each player reveals an encounter card.

B.name: Into the Storm
B.text: Into the Storm gets +1 quest point for each ally in play.

A.name: Recapture the Traitor
A.text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and add it to the staging area. Attach Galmod as a guarded objective to that enemy. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

B.name: Recapture the Traitor
B.text:
No more than 6 progress can be placed on Recapture the Traitor. The enemy guarding Galmod is immune to player card effects and cannot take damage until Recapture the Traitor has 6 progress on it.
