A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
The Glittering Caves uses the Dunlending Warriors, Glittering Caves, Caves Map, and Search for the Horn encounter sets. 

Caves Map

To set up the Caves Map, shuffle the 12 side quests from the Caves Map encounter set together and deal them faceup in a 4-across, 3-down grid like the one shown below. Each side quest in the Caves Map represents a different position in the Glittering Caves.

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
Each player places a separate player token on position 1. These player tokens mark the position of that player within the Caves Map. They can be made from anything as long as they are different from the standard game tokens. During gameplay, players may want to stick together or go off in different directions, so each player token should be distinct.

Place a damage token on position 12. This is Helm Hammerhand's token and marks his current position.

Place a resource token on the following positions:
1 player: 4, 10, 12
2 player: 3, 6, 8, 9, 12
3 player: 2, 4, 5, 7, 10, 11, 12
4 player: 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12

These represent clue tokens, and mark the positions of clues to the whereabouts of Helm's Horn.

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
Search Deck

Shuffle the Search for the Horn encounter cards together. Set X of them aside to form the Search Deck, and look at the remaining cards. X is 1 more than the number of clue tokens in the Caves Map.

Write down the positions shown in the bottom-right of the looked-at cards. These have been ruled out as the position of Helm's Horn. Shuffle the looked-at cards into the encounter deck.

During gameplay, players will discard clue tokens to reveal cards from the Search Deck and rule out more possible positions. Once all the clue tokens have been used, only 1 card will remain in the Search Deck. The position marked by this bottom card is the horn's true position.

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text:
Adjacent Positions

Two positions are called adjacent if their side quests share a border.

Labyrinth

The Labyrinth side quest has a special 'shift' effect that can be triggered by the players at the beginning of the the travel phase, even if there is no player token on Labyrinth. To shift the Labyrinth, either shift the column of side quests containing Labyrinth up or down 1 position, or shift the row containing Labyrinth right or left 1 position. Then, take the side quest displaced from the grid by this effect and place it in the empty hole created in the grid. All tokens stay on their respective sidequests during a shift.

A.name: Renown Under Many Names
A.text: Action: Search your deck for a [bi]Title[/bi] attachment (that has no other [bi]Traits[/bi]) and attach it to an eligible hero you control. Shuffle your deck.

A.name: Elendilmir
A.text:
Attach to a hero. If attached hero is Aragorn, he gets +1 [willpower].

Replace each instance of "once" in attached hero's text box with "twice".

A.name: Provoke
A.text:
Attach to an enemy. Attached enemy makes an additional attack during the combat phase, and is immune to the effects of other player cards. 

When counting the number of enemies engaged with you, attached enemy counts as 2.

Response: When attached enemy is destroyed, draw 2 cards.

A.name: Captain of the Wilds
A.text:
Attach to a [bi]Silvan[/bi] or [bi]Ranger[/bi] hero.

Action: Exhaust [name] to draw 3 cards. Then, discard all non-event cards drawn this way.

A.name: Wise Counselor
A.text: Response: When you would look at any number of facedown cards on the top of your deck, look at an additional 2 cards instead. Limit once per round.

A.name: Anduril
A.text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted. If attached to Aragorn, [name] loses the restricted keyword.

Response: At the beginning of the resource phase, if attached hero has a [leadership] icon, add 1 resource to its pool; if it has a [lore] icon, draw 1 card; if it has a [spirit] icon, reduce your threat by 1; if it has a [tactics] icon, it gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round.

A.name: Honed Skill
A.text:
Attach to a [bi]Ranger[/bi] hero and choose an attribute ([willpower], [attack], or [defense]). Limit 1 per hero.

Attached hero gains +2 of the chosen attribute. Set the hero's other attributes to 0.

A.name: Faithful Servant
A.text: Action: Put a [bi]Servant[/bi] card into play from your hand or discard pile and draw 1 card.

A.name: Balin
A.text: Response: After a card is discarded from your deck, ready [name]. Limit once per phase.

A.name: Crossing the Fords
A.text: Setup: Set Ealdwulf and each copy of Rohan Renegade aside, out of play. Add the Fords of Isen objective to the staging area, [bi]Crossing[/bi] side facup. The first player adds Grimrede and West Bank to the staging area. Each other player searches the encounter deck for a different enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Crossing the Fords
B.text:
Grimrede cannot be optionally engaged or take damage.

While there are fewer progress tokens on Crossing the Fords than resource tokens on Fords of Isen, the players cannot draw cards.

[b]Stage 1 cannot be defeated while The West Bank is in play.[/b]

A.name: Battle at the Fords
A.text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until X enemies are discarded. X is the number of players in the game, minus one (to a minimum of one). Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

B.name: Battle at the Fords
B.text:
Grimrede engages the first player. If Battle at the Fords has 10 or more progress on it, Grimrede loses indestructible.

Forced: After the first time each player engages a [bi]Dunland[/bi] enemy each round, that player returns the enemy to the staging area, then immediately engages it again.

The players cannot advance while Grimrede is in play.

A.name: Flight of Ealdwulf
A.text: When Revealed: The first player adds Ealdwulf to the staging area. Each other player adds 1 Rohan Renegade to the staging area. Flip Fords of Isen over, [bi]Pursuit[/bi] side faceup, keeping any resource tokens on it.

B.name: Flight of Ealdwulf
B.text:
Ealdwulf cannot be optionally engaged unless there are 12 progress tokens here.

[b]When Ealdwulf has been defeated, the players win the game.[/b]

A.name: Fords of Isen
A.text: Forced: At the end of the planning phase, place 3 resource tokens here. Then, if any player's total printed cost of cards they control exceeds the number of resource tokens here, that player raises their threat by X. X is the difference.

B.name: Fords of Isen
B.text: Forced: At the end of the planning phase, place 3 resource tokens here. Then, each player takes the total printed cost of cards they control and adds it to the number of resource and damage tokens on cards they control. Each player discards cards they control until that player's sum is equal to or less than the number of tokens on Chasing Down Ealdwulf.

A.name: Grimrede
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. When a card effect would reduce a player's threat by any amount, reduce that amount to 1.

Forced: At the beginning of the combat phase, [name] makes an immediate attack against the first player. The first player may remove one resource token from Fords of Isen to cancel this effect.

A.name: Ealdwulf
A.text:
The players cannot reduce their threat. 

(Some ability to counter a deck type that can make it this far).

A.name: Rohan Renegade
A.text: (Some kind of counter tech)
A.shadow: Shadow: This enemy cannot take damage until the end of the round.

A.name: Spurned Hillman
A.text: Forced: After swarming enemy engages you, raise your threat by 1.

A.name: Dunland Axe-hand
A.text: Forced: After [name] engages you, either remove one token from Fords of Isen or deal 2 damage among characters you control.
A.shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +X [attack]. Where X is the printed cost of the highest cost card you control.

A.name: Fleet-footed Dunlending
A.text: Characters with attachments cannot be declared as attackers or defenders against [name].
A.shadow: Shadow: Discard the attachment from the defending character with the highest printed cost.

A.name: West Bank
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. X is the number of resource tokens on Fords of Isen.

Travel: Remove one token from Fords of Isen.

A.name: North-south Road
A.text:
Travel: The first player discards cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and engages it.

Response: After [name] leaves play as an explored location, add one token to Fords of Isen.

A.name: Westfold Plains
A.text:
If any player's threat is 40 or greater, [name] gets +2 [threat].

Travel: A player with less than 40 threat must exhaust hero or [bi]Mount[/bi] attachment.
A.shadow: Shadow: After this attack, raise your threat by X, where X is the damage dealt by this attack.

A.name: Defensive Outcrop
A.text:
When Revealed: Heal all damage from each [b]Dunland[/bi] enemy.

(Some other kind of tech)

A.name: Risky Crossing
A.text: When Revealed: The first player may choose to add 1 resource token to Fords of Isen. If they do, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded and add that enemy to the staging area.

A.name: Coordinated Assault
A.text: When Revealed: Discard all player cards attached to enemies and locations in play. If there are fewer enemies in play than the number of players, [name] gains surge. If there are fewer locations in play than the number of players, [name] gains surge.
A.shadow: Shadow: Either remove one resource token from Fords of Isen or this enemy makes an additional attack after this one.

A.name: Heavy Losses
A.text: When Revealed: Each player raises their threat by 1 for each damage token on a character they control. Each player that did not raise their threat from this effect must deal 1 damage to 3 different characters they control.

A.name: Chaos and Confusion
A.text: Forced: After a [bi]Dunland[/bi] enemy engages you, shuffle a random card from your hand into your deck.

A.name: Back Card
A.text: T.B.D.

B.name: Back Card
B.text: T.B.D.

A.text: T.B.D.

A.text: T.B.D.

A.text: T.B.D.

A.text: T.B.D.

A.text: T.B.D.

A.name: T.B.D.
A.text: T.B.D.

A.name: Frodo Baggins
A.text:
The first player gains control of [name].

Response: After [name] defends an attack, spend 1 resource from [name]'s pool to reduce your threat by the attacking enemy's [threat]. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot take damage.

[b]If [name] leaves play, the players lose the game.[/b]

A.name: Into the West
A.text:
Limit one per deck. You cannot include this in your deck unless you have destroyed The One Ring and Scoured the Shire.

Attach to a hero. Attached hero cannot commit to the quest.

Action: Exhaust [name] to add attached hero's [willpower] to another character's [willpower] until the end of the phase.

A.name: The Scouring of the Shire
A.text:
You are playing Campaign Mode.

Setup: Each player may change hero cards he controls without incurring the +1 threat penalty. The players have earned the boon cards: Star-like Gem, Bright Mail, Scatha's Horn, and Heightened Stature. Each player chooses one and adds it to his hand. Remove all burdens from the campaign pool. Attach Grievous Wound from The Road Darkens to Frodo Baggins.

A.name: Star-like Gem
A.text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower]. If attached hero has the [bi]Hobbit[/bi] trait, it does not exhaust to quest.

A.name: Bright Mail
A.text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 [defense] (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the [bi]Hobbit[/bi] trait).

A.name: Scatha's Horn
A.text:
Attach to a hero. 
Action: Exhaust [name] to choose an attacking enemy. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets -1 [attack]  (-2 [attack] instead if the enemy is attacking a hero with the [bi]Hobbit[/bi] trait).

A.name: Heightened Stature
A.text:
Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains +2 hit points (+3 hit points instead if attached hero has the [bi]Hobbit[/bi] trait).
Action: Exhaust [name] to heal 1 damage from attached hero.

A.name: Brandywine Gate
A.text:
Immune to player card effects.

Forced: After [name] is explored, each player searches the encounter deck for a Feather-capped Shirriff and engages it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

A.name: Three-Farthing Stone
A.text:
Immune to player card effects.

Response: At the end of the quest phase, if no progress was placed on Escorted "Prisoners" as a result of questing successfully, the first player raises their threat by 3. If more than 3 progress was placed, each player engaged with more than 1 [bi]Shirriff[/bi] enemies may discard 1 [bi]Shirriff[/bi] enemy engaged with them.

A.name: Saruman
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged. [bi]Sharkey[/bi] card effects cannot be cancelled.
Forced: At the end of the staging step, add 1[pp] resource tokens to Saruman and reveal the top card of the Sharkey deck. Then, put the revealed card on the bottom of the Sharkey deck.
[b]If Saruman leaves play, the players win the game[/bi].

A.name: Grima
A.text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged.
If The Very Last Stroke has 6[pp] progress on it, progress which would be placed on the current quest may be placed on [name] instead.
[b]If there is 3[pp] progress on [name], discard Saruman from play.[/b]

A.name: Hidden Blade
A.text: When Revealed: Saruman makes an immediate attack against each player. If the attack against the first player is undefended, any damage from that attack must be assigned to Frodo Baggins.

A.name: One Ill Turn
A.text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each exhausted character. Characters cannot be healed until the end of the round.

A.name: Voice of Saruman
A.text: When Revealed: Randomly select 1 ally controlled by each player, if able. Each player deals X damage to one of their heroes, where X is their chosen ally's [attack], then discards that ally. If a player controls no allies, that player instead discards all attachments from the hero they control with the most attachments.

A.name: Curse Upon the Shire
A.text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either raise your threat by 1 or each ally you control, or discard 2 allies you control.

A.name: To the Road Again, Worm!
A.text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the encounter deck until a location is discarded and add that location to the staging area. Deal X damage among characters in play. X is the total number of remaining quest points among all locations in play.

A.name: Rouse the Cottons
A.text:
While Rouse the Cottons is the active quest, only heroes can commit to the quest.

Forced: After this quest is complete, flip it over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Fear, Fire, Foes! Awake!
A.text:
Encounter Action: Engage a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy in the encounter discard pile. Any player may trigger this effect.

Response: After the first player destroys an enemy, place 2 progress here.

Forced: After this quest is complete, flip it over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Set up Barriers
A.text:
Players cannot draw cards.

Action: Spend 1[pp] resources as a group to place 3 progress on Set up Barriers.

Forced: After this quest is complete, the first player discards all the resources from each hero they control. Then, flip this card over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Muster the Tooks
A.text:
While [name] is the active quest, only allies can commit to the quest.

Forced: After this quest is complete, flip it over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Unwanted Ruffians
A.text:
Response: After 1 copy of Gang of Ruffians is defeated, flip this card over.

Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if no progress has been placed here this round, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck if searched.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Find the Gaffer
A.text:
Travel Action: Exhaust a hero to place 2 progress on [name]. You cannot declare defenders or attackers this round. Any player can trigger this effect.

Forced: After this quest is complete, flip it over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If attached ally leaves play or has no remaining hit points, remove it and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Watch the East Road
A.text:
Cannot be chosen as the active quest.
Response: At the end of the planning phase, place X progress here. Then, reveal X encounter cards.
Forced: After this quest is complete, flip it over.

B.name: Roused Hobbits
B.text:
When Revealed: Attach to a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card. Give control of the [bi]Shirriff[/bi] card to any player. 

Attached card loses the enemy card type and gains the ally card type with [willpower] equal to its [threat]. If either Roused Hobbits or attached ally leaves play, or if attached ally has no remaining hit points, remove attached ally and Roused Hobbits from the game.

A.name: Feather-capped Shirriff
A.text:
Damage dealt to your characters by [name] is instead assigned as an increase in your threat.
While the engaged player's threat is higher than [name]'s engagement cost, [name] gets +1 [attack].

A.name: Thieving Ruffian
A.text: Forced: When [name] attacks, raise your threat by 1 for each attachment on the defending character.

A.name: Highway Robber
A.text: Forced: When [name] attacks, either discard a resource or [name] gets +2 [attack].

A.name: Gang of Ruffians
A.text:
Response: When [name] would deal damage to a character you control, dirstribute the damage among characters you control.
Forced: After [name] attacks, if the attack destroyed at least 1 of your characters, discard 1 card at random from your hand and raise your threat by 1.

A.name: Once Beloved Place
A.text: When Revealed: Each location gets +1 [threat] until the end of the round. If the there are fewer locations in the staging area than the number of players, discard cards drom the encounter deck until a location is discarded and add it to the staging area.

A.name: Sound the Alarm!
A.text: When Revealed: Exhaust each character with 3 or more printed [attack]. Players that exhausted no characters by this effect must choose and exhaust 1 character they control.
A.shadow: Shadow: If your threat is higher than the attacking enemy's engagement cost, the attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

A.name: Take Him, Lads!
A.text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by 4. Then, each player discards an ally they control and reduces their threat by X, where X is the printed cost of their discarded ally.
A.shadow: Shadow: If your threat is higher than the attacking enemy's engagement cost, the attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

A.name: Sharkey's Men
A.text: When Revealed: Each enemy gets +1 [attack] until the end of the round. If the there are fewer [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemies in play than the number of players, discard cards from the encounter deck until a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy is discarded and add it to the staging area.
A.shadow: Shadow: If the attacking enemy is a [bi]Ruffian[/bi], it makes an additional attack. The defending player may discard an ally to cancel this effect.

A.name: The Lockholes
A.text:
When Revealed: Remove all attachments and discard all tokens from the highest cost ally the first player controls and attach it facedown under [name]. 

Forced: After [name] is explored, return the attached ally to its owner's control, faceup and ready.

A.name: East Road
A.text: When Revealed: Either raise the first player's threat by 2 or [name] gains surge.

A.name: Shirriff House
A.text:
X is the highest number of non-[bi]Hobbit[/bi] characters controlled by a single player.

Forced: After [name] leaves play, the first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a [bi]Shirriff[/bi] enemy and engage it, if able. Shuffle the encounter deck if searched.

A.name: Hobbiton Road
A.text: Forced: After [name] leaves play, put a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy in the discard pile into play engaged with a player.
A.shadow: Shadow: After this attack, if the defending character was not damaged by the attack, deal 2 damage to it.

A.name: Brick Building
A.text: While [name] is in the staging area, characters cannot be healed.
A.shadow: Shadow: Deal 1 damage to the defending character.

A.name: Wooden Shed
A.text: While [name] is in the staging area, players cannot reduce their threat by more than 1 each round.
A.shadow: Shadow: Raise your threat by 1.

A.name: Many Partings
A.text: Setup: Create the Sharkey deck (see insert). Set Saruman, Grima, Brandywine Gate, Three-Farthing Stone, and each encounter side quest aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.

B.name: Many Partings
B.text:
Action: Exhaust a hero and discard a resource token in its pool. Then, add 2 resources to the set-aside Saruman.

[b]At the end of the planning phase, advance to the next quest stage.[/bi]

A.name: Escorted "Prisoners"
A.text: When Revealed: Make Brandywine Gate the active location and add Three-Farthing Stone to the staging area.

B.name: Escorted "Prisoners"
B.text:
The players cannot travel to Three-Farthing Stone unless there are 12 progress tokens here.

Forced: After a non-unique location is explored, each engaged [bi]Shirriff[/bi] enemy makes an immediate attack.

[b]The players cannot advance while the Three-Farthing Stone is in play.[/bi]

A.name: Raise the Shire
A.text: When Revealed: Randomly select 3 of the set aside side quests and put them into play (4 instead if there are 3 or 4 players).

B.name: Raise the Shire
B.text: Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource token here and raise each player's threat by the total number of resource tokens here. Then, the players may choose to advance to the next quest stage.

A.name: The Battle of Bywater
A.text: When Revealed: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Remove each [bi]Shirriff[/bi] enemy in play and in the encounter deck from the game. The first player searches the encounter deck and victory display for 1 copy of Gang of Ruffians and engages it. Then, each player not engaged with a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy searches the encounter deck for a [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy and engages it. Shuffle the encounter deck. Discard cards from the encounter deck until X enemies are discarded, and add those enemies to the staging area. X is the number of encounter side quests in play. Then, remove those side quests from the game.

B.name: The Battle of Bywater
B.text:
While any [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemy in play has any remaining hit points, all [bi]Ruffian[/bi] enemies gain indestructible.

[b]The players cannot advance while there are any enemies in play.[/bi]

A.name: The Very Last Stroke
A.text: When Revealed: If it is the combat phase, end the phase. Add Saruman and Grima to the staging area.

B.name: The Very Last Stroke
B.text:
This quest stage cannot have more progress than the number of resource tokens on Saruman.

Action: Exhaust a hero and discard 1 resource token from its pool. Then, add 1 resource to Saruman.

A.name: Back Card
A.text: T.B.D.

B.name: Back Card
B.text: T.B.D.
